derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin exemptus 'taken out, freed', past participle of eximere

entry.def: If someone or something is exempt from a particular rule, duty, or obligation, they do not have to follow it or do it.

example.ex: Men in college were exempt from military service...
example.tran: 大学在校男生免服兵役。

example.ex: Children under two years are exempt.

entry.def: To exempt a person or thing from a particular rule, duty, or obligation means to state officially that they are not bound or affected by it.

example.ex: South Carolina claimed the power to exempt its citizens from the obligation to obey federal law...
example.tran: 南卡罗来纳州声称有权力免除该州公民遵守联邦法规的义务。

example.ex: Companies with fifty-five or fewer employees would be exempted from the requirements.
example.tran: 员工在55人及以下的公司将免除这些条件。

means.word_mean: 1. grant relief or an exemption from a rule or requirement to;
1. (of persons) freed from or not subject to an obligation or liability (as e.g. taxes) to which others or other things are subject;

sentences.sentence: "a beauty somehow exempt from the aging process"
"only the very poorest citizens should be exempt from income taxes"

means.word_mean: 2. (of goods or funds) not subject to taxation;

sentences.sentence: "the funds of nonprofit organizations are nontaxable"

auth_sentence.content: The shares would be exempt from capital gains tax.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The shares would be exempt from capital gains tax.

auth_sentence.content: He is exempt on medical grounds from military service.
auth_sentence.res_content: He is exempt on medical grounds from military service.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He is exempt on medical grounds from military service.

auth_sentence.content: Countries with their own comparable system would be exempt.
auth_sentence.res_content: Countries with their own comparable system would be exempt.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Countries with their own comparable system would be exempt.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 空的, 空洞的, 空虚的
stems_affixes.word_buile: empt拿,获得,拿走后[变空]+y→拿走后[变空]
per全部+empt拿走+ory……的→全部拿走→专横的
preempt[v.以先买权取得,取代]+ive……的→adj.优先购买的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 敏捷的, 迅速的, 即时的

stems_affixes.word_buile: exempt[adj.免除的 v.免除 n.免税者;被免除义务者]+ion动作或状态→n.免除
preempt[v.以先买权取得,取代]+ion表名词→先拿→霸占
empt拿,获得,拿走后[变空]+y→拿走后[变空]

sentences.en: His bad eyesight exempted him from military service.
sentences.cn: 他因视力不好而免服兵役。

means.word_mean: 被免除…的, 被豁免的

sentences.en: These goods are exempt from customs duties.

jushi.english: Students who get very high marks are exempt from the final examination.
jushi.chinese: 得到高分的学生期终考试可以免试。

jushi.english: These goods are exempt from customs duties.
